section.section:
The district council may adopt zoning laws that provide that the affirmative vote of:
at least four members of the board of appeals are required to adopt a resolution that grants, revokes, suspends, or amends a special exception or extends the time in which to implement a special exception; and
a majority of the board of appeals is required to adopt a procedural motion regarding a special exception application.
In exercising its authority under this subsection, the district council may enact, for any zone, different voting requirements for different uses.

text.section: The decisions of the administrative office or agency may be appealed to the board of appeals or other administrative body the district council designates.
